intro: Nemacladus sigmoideus, commonly known as the zigzag mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in a zigzag pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Nemacladus sigmoideus is found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
